headline.main: In Cape Town, Apartheid’s Scars Run Deep

docs.snippet: For countless foreign visitors, Cape Town symbolizes the beauty and promise of post-apartheid South Africa, a historic mix of races and cultures. But for many black South Africans, this city is the last bastion of white rule....
docs.lead_paragraph: For countless foreign visitors, Cape Town symbolizes the beauty and promise of post-apartheid South Africa, a historic mix of races and cultures. But for many black South Africans, this city is the last bastion of white rule.

headline.print_headline: Angry at Pension Vote, Unions Plan to Skip Hispanic Event
headline.seo: Major New York Unions, Angry at Pension Vote, Plan to Boycott Hispanic Conference
headline.main: Angry at Pension Vote, Unions Plan to Skip Hispanic Event

docs.snippet: Tensions between organized labor and Albany lawmakers have grown since a vote to reduce pension benefits for new workers....
docs.abstract: Several of New York State's most prominent unions are planning to boycott Somos el Futuro, annual spring conference for Hispanic legislators in Albany; tensions between organized labor and state lawmakers have grown since a vote to reduce pension benefits for new public workers.
docs.lead_paragraph: Tensions between organized labor and Albany lawmakers have grown since a vote to reduce pension benefits for new workers.

docs.snippet: Scenes from the Broadway revival at the Neil Simon Theater....
docs.lead_paragraph: Scenes from the Broadway revival at the Neil Simon Theater.

headline.print_headline: Shooting Focuses Attention on a Program That Seeks to Avoid Guns
headline.seo: Trayvon Martin Death Spotlights Neighborhood Watch Groups
headline.main: Shooting Focuses Attention on a Program That Seeks to Avoid Guns

docs.snippet: A neighborhood watch coordinator for the Sanford, Fla., police department said the death of Trayvon Martin was a singular bad example of an otherwise valuable community resource....
docs.abstract: Sanford, Florida, police chief Bill Lee temporarily steps down as outrage mounts over the shooting of teenager Trayvon Martin by George Zimmerman, a member of a neighborhood watch in a gated community; case has brought public scrutiny to neighborhood watch programs, which some critics accuse of encouraging vigilantism; proponents of programs maintain that they explicitly prohibit the use of firearms, and are meant only to act as sources of information for law enforcement.

byline.original: By CAMPBELL ROBERTSON and JOHN SCHWARTZ
byline.contributor: Campbell Robertson reported from Sanford, and John Schwartz from New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: A neighborhood watch coordinator for the Sanford, Fla., police department said the death of Trayvon Martin was a singular bad example of an otherwise valuable community resource.

headline.print_headline: JPMorgan Discloses It Lost In an Arbitration Last Year
headline.seo: JPMorgan Discloses It Lost In Arbitration to American Century
headline.main: JPMorgan Discloses It Lost in an Arbitration Last Year

docs.snippet: JPMorgan Chase paid $384 million to American Century Investment Management for apparent breaches of a contractual agreement, but the payout remained confidential until now....
docs.abstract: JPMorgan Chase discloses it quietly paid $384 million in 2011 to American Century Investment Management after losing an arbitration over accusations of breaches related to the bank's purchase of a retirement plan services business.
docs.lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase paid $384 million to American Century Investment Management for apparent breaches of a contractual agreement, but the payout remained confidential until now.

headline.print_headline: The Big East’s Best Play On: Cardinals Get Physical In Ousting a No. 1 Seed
headline.seo: Surging Louisville Eliminates Top-Seeded Michigan State
headline.main: The Cardinals Keep Surging, Eliminating a No. 1 Seed

docs.snippet: The fourth-seeded Cardinals (29-9) defeated Michigan State for their seventh win in a row, keeping Coach Rick Pitino undefeated in 10 regional semifinals....
docs.abstract: Louisville defeats Michigan State, 57-44, in NCAA men's basketball tournament Round of 16.
docs.lead_paragraph: The fourth-seeded Cardinals (29-9) defeated Michigan State for their seventh win in a row, keeping Coach Rick Pitino undefeated in 10 regional semifinals.

docs.snippet: President Nicolas Sarkozy of France must unify a public anxious about the threat of homegrown terrorism....
docs.abstract: Editorial urges French Pres Nicolas Sarkozy to change the tone of the presidential election campaign, where immigration and religion have become divisive themes, in light of murderous rampage of Mohammed Merah in Touluose; notes Sarkozy himself has said that the killings must not be used by politicians to divide the nation along religious lines.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Nicolas Sarkozy of France must unify a public anxious about the threat of homegrown terrorism.

headline.print_headline: At Mayor’s Spring Dinner, Rivalry Is Served
headline.seo: A Spring Rite for Bloomberg’s Top Officials: Food, Drink and Rivalry
headline.main: At Mayor’s Spring Dinner, Rivalry Is Served

docs.snippet: Each spring, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg invites several of his administration’s top officials to join him for an evening that includes some gentle interagency competition....
docs.abstract: New York City Mayor Michael R Bloomberg hosts annual agency heads' dinner, event that brings top city officials together, at the mayor's expense, in the type of team-building activities more common to the private sector; this year's event had officials team up to prepare dishes in a cook-off competition at the Institute of Culinary Education.
docs.lead_paragraph: Each spring, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg invites several of his administration’s top officials to join him for an evening that includes some gentle interagency competition.

headline.print_headline: The Big East’s Best Play On: Wisconsin Misses Late, And Syracuse Advances
headline.seo: 2012 N.C.A.A. Tournament — Syracuse Advances When Wisconsin Falls Short at the End
headline.main: Wisconsin Misses in Final Seconds, and Orange Advance

docs.snippet: The Badgers, hot from 3-point range most of the game, missed two shots in the final seconds, as the Orange advanced to the Round of 8 for the first time since 2003....
docs.abstract: Syracuse defeats Wisconsin, 64-63, in NCAA men's basketball tournament Round of Round of 16.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Badgers, hot from 3-point range most of the game, missed two shots in the final seconds, as the Orange advanced to the Round of 8 for the first time since 2003.

headline.print_headline: A Class Trip Meant Much To Mexico
headline.seo: Malia Obama’s Class Trip Delights Mexico Tourism Officials
headline.main: A Class Trip Meant Much to Mexico

docs.snippet: Mexican tourism officials expressed delight that President Obama and his wife gave their daughter Malia permission to join a class trip to Oaxaca....
docs.abstract: Mexican tourism officials, who are trying to redefine the country's image as it has struggled with drug violence, express delight that President Obama and his wife have given their daughter Malia permission to join a class trip to Oaxaca, Mexico.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mexican tourism officials expressed delight that President Obama and his wife gave their daughter Malia permission to join a class trip to Oaxaca.
